    • Method Detail

      • setMaxBufferedMessages

        public MessageConsumer<T> setMaxBufferedMessages(int maxBufferedMessages)
        Description copied from interface: MessageConsumer
        Set the number of messages this registration will buffer when this stream is paused. The default value is 0. When a new value is set, buffered messages may be discarded to reach the new value.
        Specified by:
        setMaxBufferedMessages in interface MessageConsumer<T>
        Parameters:
        maxBufferedMessages - the maximum number of messages that can be buffered
        Returns:
        this registration

      • getMaxBufferedMessages

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the maximum number of messages that can be buffered when this stream is paused

        public void unregister(Handler<AsyncResult<Void>> completionHandler)
        Description copied from interface: MessageConsumer
        Unregisters the handler which created this registration
        Specified by:
        unregister in interface MessageConsumer<T>
        Parameters:
        completionHandler - the handler called when the unregister is done. For example in a cluster when all nodes of the event bus have been unregistered.

        Specified by:

      • resume

        public MessageConsumer<T> resume()
        Description copied from interface: ReadStream
        Resume reading. If the ReadSupport has been paused, reading will recommence on it.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface MessageConsumer<T>
        Specified by:
